title: AB 1144
content: The people of the State of California enact the following. Section 399.16 of the Public Utilities Code is amended to allow various electricity products from eligible renewable energy resources within the WECC transmission network service area to comply with renewables portfolio standard procurement requirements. These products may be differentiated based on their grid operation impacts and must meet project viability principles for a balanced portfolio procurement. Eligible renewable energy resource electricity products meeting specific criteria, including first point of interconnection with a California balancing authority or agreement to transfer electricity dynamically. Unbundled renewable energy credits earned by entities excluded from the definition of an electrical corporation. Unbundled renewable energy credits can be earned by electricity generated by an entity excluded from being an electrical corporation, meeting specific criteria, and used at a wastewater treatment facility owned by a public entity. The generating facility must meet certain criteria, and the electricity generated must be used at the specified facility. The renewable energy credit requirements include the generating facility meeting specific criteria, the electricity being used at a public entity-owned wastewater treatment facility, and the facility's generating capability being put into service after January 1, 2016. Additionally, the facility must not participate in a specific bioenergy program, and the renewable energy resource electricity products must be scheduled into a California balancing authority. Retail sellers must procure a certain percentage of eligible renewable energy resource electricity products for each compliance period, with specific product content requirements. Retail sellers must procure a certain percentage of eligible renewable energy resource electricity products for each compliance period, with specific product content requirements. Contracts executed after June 1, 2010, have limitations on the percentage of eligible renewable energy resource electricity products that can meet product content requirements. Contracts executed before June 1, 2010, count towards procurement requirements if the renewable energy resource was eligible at the time of contract execution. Retail sellers must procure a certain percentage of eligible renewable energy resource electricity products for each compliance period. Contracts executed after June 1, 2010, have limitations on increasing capacity or changing resources. Retail sellers can apply for a reduction in procurement content requirements under certain conditions, but the obligation cannot be reduced below 65 percent after December 31, 2016. A public entity selling renewable energy credits cannot make marketing claims about the renewable attributes of the electricity that earned the credit. The renewable attributes are transferred to the purchaser. The electricity generated and sold by the public entity must be included in the total retail sales for calculating renewables portfolio standard procurement obligations.
